name: Asian Music
description: Rooted in the traditions of Asian peoples.

children.name: Buddhist Music
children.description: Encompassing the various musical practices that have developed throughout Buddhist history and across the many regions Buddhism spread to.

children.name: Central Asian Music
children.description: Music of the former Soviet Central Asian republics, Mongolia, Western China and related neighbouring peoples.

children.name: East Asian Music
children.description: Covers the different forms of music with origins in Japan, Korea, China, Taiwan, and Vietnam.

children.name: Ghazal
children.description: Developed in Arabia with further evolutions in Persia and the Indian subcontinent; based on rhyming couplets with intricate schemes and deal with romance, loss, and religion.

children.name: North Asian Music
children.description: Music of the indigenous peoples of Siberia, the Russian Far East, and outlying islands.

children.name: South Asian Music
children.description: Traditional and modern regional music of India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, which culturally have close connections.

children.name: Southeast Asian Music
children.description: Geographic meta-parent that covers different forms with origins in Burma, Cambodia, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, East Timor, Laos, Singapore, and Brunei.

children.name: West Asian Music
children.description: Music of West Asia, a region covering most of what is commonly known as the Middle East but not extending into North Africa.
